answers.answer: Generally most retinal bleeds such as you've had clear over a period of weeks to months. In a small minority of patients the blood doesn't clear and an operation called a vitrectomy is necessary. Ask your Eye MD next time in about the amount of blood and the rate of clearing.JCH III MD

question: Two days ago, I experienced a retinal tear and subsequent vitrious hemorrhage.  Having been in healthcare for many years and having glaucoma,diabetes, htn and severe myopia and astigmatism, all of which I keep a close eye on, I was pretty sure of what was happening and went immediately to the ER.  Within 36 hours, I had a laser procedure of seal the tear.  My vision is now very cloudy with a quite large floater, all of which is obscuring vision in my left eye.  Is there a general time frame for the clearing of the cloudiness?  Will this horrid floater dissipate or is there a procedure I may have to undergo to rid my eye of this obstruction?Thank you, Debra S.
title: Retinal tear/Laser procedure/Recovery
